blog.name: malfoy--pottah
blog.title: Kaisetic
blog.description: A completely random blog with no actual theme

body:
Ted Talks part One

Harry Potter spoilers

If someone calls Snape “snevillus” one more time I’m going to lose my shit. It’s Severus and we all know that. You may be pissed that he doesn’t suck up to harry but that just means he is actually a good teacher. Snape is a good damn hero and deserves to be treated as such. The only good reasons to not like him are if you

1. Are a death eater (he would be the reason you didn’t win the war)

2. If you haven’t finished the series.

Thank you for comming to my TED Talk

blog.name: maybeshesnaped
blog.title: 𝑽𝒖𝒍𝒏𝒆𝒓𝒂 𝑺𝒂𝒏𝒆𝒏𝒕𝒖𝒓
blog.description:
| Snape is my son and Alan is my father |
sninsta: @thatbastardrickman

summary:
Snape and the mirror of Erised
I found these on Instagram and I think these are what Snape sees on the mirror before and after...
body:
Snape and the mirror of Erised

I found these on Instagram and I think these are what Snape sees on the mirror before and after Lily’s death.

Before her death, when she’s with James, he sees him with her; he longs to be with her, the thing he most desires in the world is that she had chosen him.

After her death, he only wants her to be alive. He doesn’t care whether it’s with him or James. He simply wants her to be alive and well, and he desperately needs to feel like he wasn’t instrumental to her death.

That’s what personally believe he saw in the mirror before and after Lily’s death 🖤

Credit to the artists of both of these

blog.name: famdommcfanface
blog.title: BBC Ghosts has consumed my life
blog.description: Non-binary any pronouns fine usually go by she/her but don't worry about it. Bisexual, 16, English and a complete mess. Yeah so I just reblog stuff, but good stuff so follow. All Noel Fielding shit, Richard Ayoade, actually most British comedy, weird obscure sitcoms from ten-twenty years ago. Also modern shit, currently obsessed by Ghosts. Music from the 70s/80s (Queen and David Bowie my faves), maladaptive daydreaming and other shit I don't even know.

title: Weird HP theory
body:
OK so I have a weird theory with the Harry Potter houses.
So there aren’t actually any traits that determine which house you go into, with only four traits you can’t really fit everyone into them.
The hat just put you into whatever house you would be happy in (it can obviously see the future).
I mean you rarely see anyone saying they don’t belong in that house or they would be happier in another house. And personally I know I’m a Slytherin but would be much happier in Ravenclaw so fuck it I’m Ravenclaw.
I know there are some people who don’t seem to fit into this but they do if you think about it (unless I’ve forgotten any)
The most obvious is Albus. He clearly wanted to be in Gryffindor but ended up in Slytherin and was miserable. Well, he would have been miserable whatever. We see what would have happened were he in Gryffindor; he’s still friends with Scorpius but they’re not in the same house and that must be worse. Also it’s the cursed child so who listens to that.
Would Draco have been happier in a different house? He may have had better friends etc but he wouldn’t have had the approval of his father, which he always kind of wanted.
There’s others I could get into but I can’t be bothered.
So yeah. Have that headcannon.

summary: I know we all talk about the greatness that is the cold bitch with a heart of gold slytherin dating the softest, warmest and...
body: I know we all talk about the greatness that is the cold bitch with a heart of gold slytherin dating the softest, warmest and kindest (and secretly badass) hufflepuff trope. But please allow me to bring your attention to the fantastic “I am oh so intelligent, Einstein would quiver in my presence” Ravenclaw falling head over heels for a dumb as a stump Gryffindor. A Gryffindor that is just this big sweet jock but also only has one (1) brain cell functioning at a time. I just want a Ravenclaw that thinks they are the peak of human intelligence being absolutely enraptured by a person who pronounced quiche like quickie

blog.title: "Wha'cha Writin', Sugar?"
blog.description: Writer; poet; general complainer • She/They (or He; it doesn't bother me) • CAUTION: I post mainly fandom-related things, primarily Harry Potter • My fanfiction | My tip jar • I repost poetry from my Instagram, @purpleprosodies • Commissions for fics and poetry are ever open • I post witch ish on my side-blog: Val The Sigilist

summary: The only things I can think of is some sort of confusion between your story and another, amnesia to characters that aren't...
question: The only things I can think of is some sort of confusion between your story and another, amnesia to characters that aren't necessarily from the main crossover sources, or just plain not having read that particular chapter, and not... noticed that they skipped a chapter (due to seeing an update and reading the newest chapter). Or just too much time passed since they read that chapter. It doesn't appear to be some sort of face blindness issue either, since descriptions were given as examples...
answer: That’s what I thought, too! Like, did they just forget? I’m not upset about it, just really, really confused. But if they did forget, why didn’t they just reread the previous chapter to refresh their memory? The chapter 13 and 14 had basically every significant character, in canon and manufactured by me, in them. Why would you read the newest chapter of a fic you can’t remember?

reblog.comment: That’s what I thought, too! Like, did they just forget? I’m not upset about it, just really, really confused. But if they did forget, why didn’t they just reread the previous chapter to refresh their memory? The chapter 13 and 14 had basically every significant character, in canon and manufactured by me, in them. Why would you read the newest chapter of a fic you can’t remember?

The chapter 13 and 14 had basically every significant character, in canon and manufactured by me, in them. Why would you read the newest chapter of a fic you can’t remember?
